info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 30 at 9:47PM MDT until July 30 at 11:30PM MDT by NWS Riverton WY
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of central Wyoming, including the following county, Fremont.
* WHEN...Until 1130 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 942 PM MDT, Local law enforcement has reported flooded roadways along US 20/26 due to thunderstorms and heavy rains. US 20/26 from Moneta to Casper has been closed due to this flooding. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding along US 20/26. An estimated 2 to 3 inches of rain have fallen. - US 20/26 east of Moneta is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain may continue minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... US 20/26 from Moneta to Casper and mainly rural areas of Eastern Fremont County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM MDT THIS EVENING
